content: in an unrelated conversation with mozilla legal the topic of translating policies (such as the privacy policy, the trademark policy, etc) came up
as a fyi, the current consensus seems to be that translating policies is fine, but we'll have to add a disclaimer saying only the english version is actually valid
they're drafting a snippet on their end

I think this is also mentioned in the translation guidelines document:
https://github.com/rust-lang/www.rust-lang.org/blob/master/TRANSLATIONS.md#special-case-policies
@Pietro Albini i believe we already do this
@Manish Goregaokar most of the translations I checked do not
we need to add an unused key that has a disclaimer and include it on all policy pages when the language isn't english
@Manish Goregaokar yep moz legal is drafting it

hey all! just a note that we merged https://github.com/rust-lang/www.rust-lang.org/pull/1282 to the website, which adds a disclaimer in the UI on top of all the policies page and updated the crates.io and docs.rs privacy policies
:thumbs_up: so I guess this means we no longer need to add a disclaimer in the translations themselves, correct?
yeah, I guess it would be appropriate to remove the (now) redundant disclaimer
_rvidal @apiraino yep, the disclaimer in the individual policies is not needed anymore
